title: Beginner Full Body Routine
description: This beginner-friendly challenge includes a full-body workout that focuses on building strength and improving mobility. It’s perfect for those just starting out or getting back into fitness.
tip: Focus on form rather than speed. Don’t worry if you can’t complete all reps at first; consistency is key!

title: Intermediate Strength Building
description: This challenge focuses on building muscle strength and endurance. It’s designed for those who have some experience with weight training and are ready to level up their workouts.
tip: Increase the weight of your exercises progressively. Ensure you’re using proper form to prevent injury.

title: Advanced HIIT Challenge
description: An intense High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) challenge designed to push your limits. This is for individuals who are already in good shape and looking to improve their cardiovascular fitness and burn fat.
goals: 3 sets of 15 push-ups (clap push-ups for advanced)
tip: Rest is crucial. If you feel too fatigued, take a break before continuing to avoid injury.

title: Yoga Flexibility Boost
description: This yoga challenge is perfect for those looking to improve their flexibility and mobility. Ideal for both beginners and experienced practitioners, it will help you with muscle recovery, balance, and flexibility.
goals: 5 minutes of gentle stretching for the hamstrings
tip: Breathe deeply during each stretch. Don’t push too hard, and take your time to increase your flexibility gradually.

title: Core Strength Challenge
description: This challenge targets the core muscles, including abs, lower back, and obliques. It’s great for improving overall stability, posture, and endurance.
goals: 3 sets of 30-second side planks per side
tip: Ensure you engage your core throughout each movement. Avoid arching your lower back during planks and leg raises.

title: Cardio Endurance Challenge
description: This cardio challenge is designed to improve your stamina and endurance. It includes running, cycling, and bodyweight exercises to keep your heart rate up.
goals: 30-minute brisk walk or jog (3 times a week)
20 minutes of cycling (3 times a week)
20-minute bodyweight workout (squats, lunges, jumping jacks, etc.)
tip: Increase the intensity gradually. Add a bit more time or distance to each session to challenge yourself.

title: Leg Strength & Conditioning
description: Focus on building strong legs and glutes with this leg-strengthening challenge. A mix of squats, lunges, and other bodyweight exercises will help you improve power and mobility.
tip: Start with bodyweight exercises, then add weight as your strength increases. Focus on proper form, especially during squats and lunges.

title: Upper Body Strength Challenge
description: Designed to enhance upper body strength, this challenge focuses on arms, shoulders, and back using bodyweight and dumbbells for resistance training.
tip: Focus on controlled movements to get the most out of your workout. Keep your core engaged for stability during upper body exercises.
